definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Change that arrangement and you can dramatically alter the resulting organism.
sentences.chinese: 改变这个排列你就能完全改变最后的生物体。

sentences.english: Those variants equip an organism specially well to cope with the exigencies of the environments.
sentences.chinese: 变异使生物体配备得特别完善以应付环境的严酷要求。

sentences.english: The fatty acids are then converted by the organisms to an aldehyde that includes a carbon atom bonded to an oxygen atom (together they create what's called a carbonyl group).
sentences.chinese: 脂肪酸被生物体转化成包含碳氧双键即羰基的醛。

sentences.english: Perhaps a maple forest is but a grand organism composed of lesser organisms.
sentences.chinese: 可能枫树林是由小生物体组成的巨大的生物体。

sentences.english: Perhaps a maple forest is but a grand organism composed of lesser organisms.
sentences.chinese: 可能枫树林是由小生物体组成的巨大的生物体。

sentences.english: In so doing, there was no codependence that was biological.
sentences.chinese: 这样做，就没有生物体之间的相互依赖。

sentences.english: And in the end, both mixotrophs and phototrophs tended to fare better when living together.
sentences.chinese: 而这两类生物体也往往在共生时生长的更好。

sentences.english: The amount of respiration depends upon the degree of activity of the organism.
sentences.chinese: 生物体呼吸量的大小取决于其活动量的大小。

sentences.english: In the film, the name "Autobot" stands for "Autonomous Robotic Organism.
sentences.chinese: 在影片中，“汽车人”指的是“独立机器生物体”。

sentences.english: The small round blue organisms at the lumenal border are cryptosporidia.
sentences.chinese: 在内腔边界的小圆兰色的生物体是隐孢子虫。

sentences.english: Ceramide may be generated from many metabolism routes.
sentences.chinese: 生物体内神经酰胺有多种生成途径。

sentences.english: Whenever wine contained no living organisms, the material remained undiseased.
sentences.chinese: 只要酒中不含活的生物体，此物一定可保持不变质。

sentences.english: Blast wave can cause damage to organisms, which is called blast injury.
sentences.chinese: 冲击波作用于生物体造成的损伤称为冲击伤。

sentences.english: The sequence helps determine the traits of an organism.
sentences.chinese: 该序列有助于确定一个生物体的特性。

sentences.english: The circadian rhythm depicts a basic feature of life.
sentences.chinese: 生物体机能活动的日节律是一种基本的生命现象。

sentences.english: The individual archaeans are some of the smallest organisms ever found.
sentences.chinese: 这种古生菌是迄今为止发现的最小的生物体中的一种。

pinyin: tuo1 yang3 he2 tang2 he2 suan1
